dialogue.text: (Boyfriend is walking around nearby a abandoned stage, after fulfilling a mission sent out by his boss, Daddy Dearest.)
Sweet, I finally finished this mission. Hopefully I can ask him for a break from anymore missions.
(Boyfriend hears voices coming from inside the abandoned stage, with one of the voices belonging to someone he recognized- his boss.)
Huh? I don't recall him telling me to meet up here. And who's the other person he's talking to?
(Boyfriend gets closer to where the voices emits, eavesdropping to the conversation of his boss with what seems to be a girl.)
(Girlfriend bickers with Daddy Dearest, her father who runs a business of assasinating people, wanting to be a part of it.)
(Girlfriend looking desperate.)
Dad, come on. I just want to help out with the business! At least let me help a little bit!
(Daddy Dearest being adamant on his stance and stressed out.)
I've told you multiple times, but a no is a no. What about your singing career? You've been doing so well, sweetie.
How about you just focus on that and let daddy do the work?
How hard could it be, dad? I can-
(Daddy Dearest yells at his daughter.)
Like I said, no! You donâ€™t have slightest idea of what I do, and I will make sure it stays that way!
-heavy sigh-
Look, I'm sorry I yelled at you, but let's just forget this talk ever happened.
My decision is still final. I have business to attend to, so please, focus on your current career, sweetheart. It's for the greater good.
(Daddy Dearest left the premise of the abandoned stage, leaving his daughter.)
-sniffles-
(Girlfriend holds back her tears, alone on the abandoned stage.)
(Boyfriend then pops out, feeling sympathetic.)
He's not wrong y'know? The job is way tougher than it looks.
Wasting a perfectly good career on this isn't worth it at all, considering you're probably good at it.
Plus it's more fun.
(Girlfriend looks over to Boyfriend, mildly confused of what he was talking about.)
You're one of his employees?
Yeah, well, you could say that-
(Girlfriend cuts off Boyfriend.)
Help me! Convince my dad that I can help out!
(Boyfriend looks away, hoping to not be a part of the issue.)
No way. You could get yourself hurt-
What do you mean by hurt? I'm NINETEEN- old enough to handle myself and it's just about handling musicians like me! I'm not a kid anymore!
And you know what?
(Girlfriend briefly pauses, transforming to her demonic form, revealing her true self to Boyfriend due to her getting upset.)
I am capable enough to protect myself anyways.
(Boyfriend looking partially flustered, possibly scared and surprised by Girlfriend's intimidation.)
Y-you're... a demon?
(Boyfriend then looks away, getting a grip of the situation and considering the pros and cons of helping her out.)
Alright. Fine. I'll help you out.
But only because you're my boss' daughter.
(And also because I would not like to get on my boss' daughter's bad side. Especially if they're a demon.)
(Girlfriend instantly turns back to her normal form, looking happy.)
Really?!
But I won't be doing this for free.
Anything!
While I teach you how to shoot, how about you teach me how to sing?
(Girlfriend steps back, looking slightly puzzled.)
Huh?
(Boyfriend scratches the back of his head, blushing over his ridiculous condition of the deal.)
I- I just really liked singing and music back then, alright? Plus, you are a singer, so you should be pretty good at it, right?
I don't see any reason of using you in any other ways.
Alright then. I don't know why I would need to learn to shoot for this, but it sounds fun! I could use some new experience anyways.
(Girlfriend who was slightly taken back by his conditions, smiled.)
Now...
Sing after me!
W-wait, right now?
